Text:
Months have passed since bringing the children from 
 Boutoume back home to Hekseville, but their passage 
 through the rift plane that brought us back left them 
 in a hibernation state.
Hold on Zaza. I'll bring you home, whatever it takes.
A scientist said he had the solution for waking them up, \n and he needed my and Kat's help to pull off the experiment.
I woke from a very strange dream this morning. \n The only thing I remember is a question:
What would you sacrifice to save the children in the Ark?
Zaza, I'm scared.
Sachya, it's okay, just stay close to me.
Stop! Don't make me call the police!
Try it, they can't help you.
St-Stay back!
Oww!
Fun's over.
It's that creepy Gravity Shifter!
Thug: \n N-Nevi!
I need to get them away from the energy collector.
Back away from that machine. Now!
Defeat the Thugs
I won't let you or anyone else stop the experiment!
Now to take out the Nevi...
Thug: \n We'll do whatever we like!
Thug: \n Yeah, you can't tell us what to do!

This thing is supposed 
 to draw in Nevi... 
 And it's my job to 
 take 'em out.
Once we trap enough \n of them in all of the \n machines...
We'll have the energy \n we need to start \n the experiment.
Nevi. Just like they said.
The machine's energy tank should be full.
I need to grab the energy tank from the machine.
One energy tank down.
With enough energy, they can wake the children in the Ark.
Zaza... You're coming home.
Thug: \n You're the best the city could get to help 'em?

Raven, I just got 
 a report that some 
 thugs were over 
 at the first site.
They've been taken \n care of.
Th-They have? \n Well that's \n good news!
Can you believe 'em!?

What kind of heartless 
 criminals would get in 
 the way of saving those 
 children in the Ark?

Who knows, but I 
 won't let them or 
 anyone else stop 
 the experiment.
Glad to hear it!
I need to get to \n the next machine.
Yes ma'am! I'll tell \n the others to keep \n up their watch.

We really couldn't 
 do this without 
 you and the other 
 Shifter.

We'll have all the 
 energy we need 
 in no time with 
 your help!
Thug: \n Wh-What's that!?
Thug: \n Nevi! Run!
Zaza!?
Sachya? \n Sachya, where are you!?
I must be seeing things. \n How could Zaza be here?

This is all my fault. 
 I should've tried 
 harder. I was 
 supposed to protect her.
No, it's my fault-
I've gotta find her. \n Sachya! Sachya!
Zaza and the others \n must be trapped in \n a nightmare.

Zaza, hold on... 
 I'll do whatever it 
 takes to bring 
 you back.
And you'll see me again, \n I promise.

Heya Raven! 
 Is this all to help 
 those kids sleepin' 
 in the Ark?
Sorry to bother you, \n but we need to chat.
Gade, Cyanea? \n Can't we do this later? \n I'm busy.
Oh yes, time is an \n important problem. \n Speaking of which...

We need to talk about 
 the Ark. This whole plan 
 to rescue the children 
 is giving me bad vibes.
And space-time \n is having a fit.
It's like it can tell \n something bad is \n about to happen.
Do you even try \n to make sense?
I feel... \n So... \n Sleepy...

Hmph, sounds like 
 the Dream Guardian 
 is about to join our 
 conversation.
Cyanea is asleep.

The children in the Ark 
 are trapped in a place 
 between reality and 
 dreams.

The only way to wake 
 them is to guide 
 them back to where 
 they belong.

Getting them back is 
 exactly what I was 
 doing before you 
 interrupted me!
The scientist in charge \n said that, with enough \n energy...

He could restart the 
 Ark and bring them 
 back to where they 
 belong.
Sounds reckless \n to me.
Playing with time \n and space isn't \n a good idea.
You of all people \n should understand \n the risks.
Your very existence \n is an instability.

But you're the one who 
 told me the time was 
 coming when they would 
 rise again!

What do you want 
 me to do? Sit back 
 and wait for them 
 to wake up?

While you both do 
 nothing, I'm going 
 to save Zaza 
 and the others.
You've already \n wasted enough \n of my time!
Hmph. \n She does have \n a temper...
We did warn her. \n The rest is up to \n the third Crea-
Wha-? \n Was I sleeping again? \n I'm sorry...
Hey, we all need \n a little shut-eye \n now and again.
Let's go see \n how this will \n all play out.
Raven! Did you just \n get here too?
Yeah, and I brought \n the energy we need.
I was wondering if \n you would ever show \n up. Hold on...
Energy levels are good. \n We should be able to \n commence the experiment.
I feel it's worth \n bringing it to \n your attention...
But today's experiment \n is all thanks to my \n boss, Dr. Brahman.
When today is done, \n he'll be famous.

I need to rush these 
 energy tanks over 
 there. Thank you for 
 the good work!

Yeesh, he makes it 
 sound like all of this 
 is just a line for 
 some guy's resume.
Guess we've done all \n we can do...
Let's head over to \n the plaza and join \n the crowd.
Gade and Cyanea should \n be there already.
Too bad Syd had to \n pick today of all \n days to call in sick.
Can you believe him, \n taking such an important \n day off?
Kat... Do you really \n think this will wake \n the children in the Ark?

Having second thoughts? 
 You were the one 
 who was all for 
 the experiment.
I'm sure everything \n will turn out alright.

You're right. 
 And I'll do 
 whatever it takes 
 to bring them home.
You're acting kind \n of strange today, \n are you alright?

Let's go! 
 You wouldn't want 
 to miss your chance 
 to see Zaza.
Plan to Rescue Ark Children
Experiment Takes Place in Freedom Square
All we can do now is \n hope this wakes Zaza \n and the others...
Yeah...

...and as a result, we have 
 a way to free the sleeping 
 children from their 
 temporal prison.
Now, let's-
Excuse me.
That Ark \n shouldn't exist.
You won't get the \n results you're looking \n for from an illusion.
Wh-Where did \n you come from?
Although sometimes bad \n methods can bring \n about good results.

Going through with 
 your experiment will 
 certainly shake 
 things up.
Pardon me, is anyone \n missing our little \n scientist here?
I know what \n you're hiding.
But I'll let \n it slide for now.
He went quite fast. \n Wonder what's wrong.
Not sure, but it's \n starting.
No...
Raven!?
I knew today was going to be interesting.
The dream is starting to crack.
The world can't process this complication. \n And she's at the centre.
This won't be an easy problem to fix.
Hmm, I can barely see anything from way up here.
Now for the next energy collector.
Where'd they set the next one up again...?
I need to get a better look, maybe from higher up.
Shift Gravity to Fly Up and \n Have a Look Around
I can get a good look from here.
Time to have a look around.
There.
I need to take down Nevi and fill the machine's energy tank.
Now they're coming from the sky, better take 'em out.
That should be enough.
Done, now on to the next machine.
I need to take out the Nevi so I can collect their energy...
That takes care of the Nevi.
The next machine should be the last one.
I better get moving.
That's the last tank I need. I hope Kat's finished with her part.
Zaza, wait!
What are you doing here?
I need to drop the energy tanks off.
Now to drop this energy off.
Deliver the Energy
Police Officer: \n Some thugs slipped through our barrier.
Gade: \n I tried my best to warn you, now what happens will happen.
Cyanea: \n Hey Raven, I'm going to watch the Ark experiment.
More Nevi... Fine, I'll take you out too.
???: \n Sachya...
Hey Raven!
Police Officer: \n Raven! I've got bad news!
Once I deliver this, I can bring Zaza home.
Collect
Talk
Defeat the Nevi
I've got to fill and collect the rest of the energy tanks.
Head to the Next \n Energy Collector
Energy Collector: \n Nevi attract mode enabled. Processing energy.
Collect the Energy Tank \n from the Machine
Police Officer: \n We're making sure no one enters the area for you.
Police Officer: \n Let us know if anything comes up.
Police Officer: \n Some thugs were messing with one of the collectors?
Police Officer: \n We're on high alert - this experiment is too important.
Police Officer: \n We're lucky to have you Gravity Shifters around.
Police Officer: \n Thank you for helping us with the energy collection!
Police Officer: \n Who knew the Nevi would turn out to be so useful?
Police Officer: \n Nothing to report over here, just standin' watch.
Police Officer: \n Once you've got that energy, we'll start the experiment.
Police Officer: \n They're gettin' antsy waiting for their energy.
Police Officer: \n Heard the guy in charge of the experiment was some big shot.
Police Officer: \n Everyone's over in the plaza waiting for the experiment to begin.
